text:
<@U4H19D1D2> I've noticed something else about the Replace function (I'm guessing most people just cancel and place a new order, which perhaps I should do!), below the replace fails as the bet has already had an action on it, that error makes sense, however after this the order is never removed from the blotter and the status remains as OrderStatus.REPLACING until I kill the process. This of course means no further orders can be placed on this runner as the blotter thinks there is 1 order remaining. This is obviously a pretty rare occurrence, but I've noticed it a few times and I think the below shows the process flow, but at the end presumably a better outcome would be that the order is removed (i.e. set to EXECUTION_COMPLETE) instead?

This is going to be very tricky to replicate, but if you agree its a bug I'll raise an issue (this is in live btw not simulation).

elements.text:
I've noticed something else about the Replace function (I'm guessing most people just cancel and place a new order, which perhaps I should do!), below the replace fails as the bet has already had an action on it, that error makes sense, however after this the order is never removed from the blotter and the status remains as OrderStatus.REPLACING until I kill the process. This of course means no further orders can be placed on this runner as the blotter thinks there is 1 order remaining. This is obviously a pretty rare occurrence, but I've noticed it a few times and I think the below shows the process flow, but at the end presumably a better outcome would be that the order is removed (i.e. set to EXECUTION_COMPLETE) instead?

This is going to be very tricky to replicate, but if you agree its a bug I'll raise an issue (this is in live btw not simulation).

text: I think there might be an issue already? If you can create a strategy to replicate would be helpful

elements.text: I think there might be an issue already? If you can create a strategy to replicate would be helpful

text: May be tricky, I think this occurs when a replace fails due to BPE being off and the price having moved...its difficult to replicate

elements.text: May be tricky, I think this occurs when a replace fails due to BPE being off and the price having moved...its difficult to replicate

text: I think we did raise this a while back, but if I recall correctly you couldn't replicate it so it got closed. Which makes sense as its a bit niche, but its definitely still occuring.

elements.text: I think we did raise this a while back, but if I recall correctly you couldn't replicate it so it got closed. Which makes sense as its a bit niche, but its definitely still occuring.

text: I tried replicating, with the replacement price lower than the best back price, but that produces a 'BET_LAPSED_PRICE_IMPROVEMENT_TOO_LARGE' and it works fine, the above is slightly different, in that its a BET_TAKEN_OR_LAPSED error I need to replicate, which is tough! I'll create a placeholder issue and will add if I can come up with more/better info.
